Profiling of Mass Spectrometry Data for Ovarian Cancer Detection Using Negative Correlation Learning
publication.jconf: Int. Conference on Artificial Neural Networks
publication.keyword: Machine Learning;Mass Spectrometry;Negative Correlation Learning;Profiles Methods;Ovarian Cancer;
publication.abstract: Abstract. This paper proposes a novel Mass Spectrometry data profiling method for ovarian cancer detection based on negative correlation learning (NCL). A modified Smoothed,Nonlinear Energy Operator (SNEO) and correlation-based peak selection were applied to detected informative peaks for NCL to build a pre- diction model. In order to evaluate the performance,of this novel method,without bias, we employed randomization techniques by

Modeling viral economies for digital media
publication.keyword: Digital Media;Distributed System;Dynamic Pricing;Economic Model;Financial Performance;Peer To Peer;Performance Measure;Scale Free Network;User Behavior;Viral Marketing;Client Server;Scale Free;
publication.abstract: Financial efficiency is the premier performance measure for most systems. Existing economic ecosystems for distribu- tion of multimedia leave a lot to be desired: client-server platforms do not scale well resulting in substantial opera- tional costs, whereas peer-to-peer platforms cannot police copyright control and are thus notorious for not being able to capitalize on its vast delivery potential. publication.title: Collusion-Resistant video Fingerprinting for Large User Group
publication.abstract: Digital fingerprinting protects multimedia content from illegal re- distribution by uniquely marking copies of the content distributed to each user. Most existing multimedia fingerprinting schemes consider userset on the scale of thousands for evaluation. How- ever, in real applications such as cable TV and DVD distribution, the potential users can be as many as 10 âˆ¼ 100 million. This large

publication.title: Analysis of Nonlinear Collusion Attacks on Fingerprinting Systems for Compressed Multimedia
publication.abstract: In this paper, we analyze the effect of various collusion at- tacks on fingerprinting systems for compressed multimedia. We evaluate the effectivenessof the collusion attacks in terms of the probability of detection and accuracy in estimating the host signal. Our analysis shows that applying averaging col- lusion on copies of moderately compressed content gives a highly accurate estimation of the

publication.title: Performance Study on Multimedia Fingerprinting Employing Traceability Codes
publication.abstract: Digital flngerprinting is a tool to protect multimedia content from illegal redistribution by uniquely marking copies of the content dis- tributed to each user. Collusion attack is a powerful attack whereby several difierently-flngerprinted copies of the same content are combined together to attenuate or even remove the flngerprint. Coded flngerprint- ing is one major category of flngerprinting techniques against collusion.

publication.title: Binary forensic code for multimedia signals: resisting minority collusion attacks
Building efficient and effective multimedia fingerprints via joint coding and embedding
publication.keyword: Computational Complexity;Content Distribution;Digital Fingerprinting;Error Correction Code;
publication.abstract: Digital fingerprinting protects multimedia content from illegal redistribution by uniquely marking every copy of the content distributed to each user. One major category of collusion-resistant fingerprinting employs an explicit step of coding. Most existing works on coded fingerprinting mainly focus on the code-level issues and treat the embedding issues through abstract assumptions without examining the overall performance. In this paper,

publication.title: Group-based joint coding and embedding technique for multimedia fingerprinting
publication.jconf: Security, Steganography, and Watermarking of Multimedia Contents
publication.keyword: Error Correction Code;Minimum Distance;Prior Knowledge;Spread Spectrum;
publication.abstract: This paper proposes a group-based flngerprinting scheme employing a joint coding and embedding strategy to trace multimedia distribution and proactively prevent the leak of multimedia information. Taking advantage of the prior knowledge on the collusion pattern, we construct compact flngerprints that consist of user sub-codeword and group sub-codeword and are embedded in host signal via spread spectrum technique. The detection

publication.title: Confidentiality-preserving rank-ordered search
publication.authors: ashwin swaminathan,yinian mao,guan-ming su,hongmei gou,avinash l. varna,min wu
publication.keyword: Algorithm Design;Data Center;Data Collection;Indexation;Information Search and Retrieval;Search and Retrieval;System Design;information re trieval;
publication.abstract: This paper introduces a new framework for confidentiality preserving rank-ordered search and retrieval over large docu- ment collections. The proposed framework not only protects document/query confidentiality against an outside intruder, but also prevents an untrusted data center from learning information about the query and the document collection. We present practical techniques for proper integration of rel- evance scoring methods and

publication.abstract: The widespread use of mobile, personal computing devices, together with recent advances in wireless communication technologies, pose a myriad of new opportunities for lever- aging the commerce of digital goods.
